revised_title: Smallpox Infection in Pregnancy and Its Impact on Mother and Child
tldr: A woman who had smallpox while pregnant delivered a stillborn child full of pustules. The author discusses the possibility of the child catching the smallpox during pregnancy or after birth. The case raises questions about the transmission of infectious diseases during pregnancy and their impact on both mother and child.
scientific_discipline: Medicine and Health Sciences > Obstetrics and Gynecology
